Most mathematical and scientific problems involve some changing quantities that may or may not affect one another; understanding these quantities often depends on assembling and solving some related differential equations. In the simplest cases, time is the only independent variable and the relevant models are ordinary differential equations (ODEs), for which there is a standard arsenal of tools. This course will teach you to use these methods and thereby gain insight into the problems from which ODEs arise.

To succeed in this course, you must

  • stay caught up with the readings and assignments,
  • work together within the parameters of the Honor Code, and
  • talk to me whenever you have questions.

If you don’t understand something, get help immediately!

Textbook

Grading

To help you stay caught up with the material and practice for exams, there will be frequent quizzes and homework. There will be three exams, two during the semester and a comprehensive final exam at 9:00 a.m. on Friday, May 4. Your scores on these components will contribute to your final grade as follows:

  • In-class exams (2): 20% each
  • Quizzes & homework: 20%
  • Final exam: 20%
  • Best of these: 20%

If you cannot avoid missing a quiz or exam for a legitimate reason (e.g., being out of town to participate in a University-related activity), you must talk to me ahead of time to get permission to submit your work late. Otherwise, make-up quizzes/exams will not be given.

Honor Code

As a Sewanee student, you have already sworn to uphold the Honor Code; I expect you to comport yourself accordingly. Work with your classmates to understand the course material, but submit work that is truly your own. You must not consult with other students when taking exams or quizzes. In addition to avoiding a guilty conscience, you’ll learn more this way anyhow!

Attendance

Missing class seriously undermines the educational process, so be responsible and don’t do it unless absolutely necessary.

Special needs

Please notify me immediately if you have any documented special needs that need to be accommodated.
